New Records: Morocco confirmed a 3-1 victory over Sierra Leone in their international friendly match.
Youssef En-Nesyri scored a brace for Morocco, while Sofyan Amrabat and Azzedine Ounahi each contributed one goal.
Key Match Events: Morocco scored three goals in total, with the first goal coming from En Nesyri in the 30th minute and the second from Boufal five minutes later.
The match was held at the Laurent Pokou Stadium in San Pédro, Côte d'Ivoire.
Pre-Game Insights: Morocco and Sierra Leone last met in a 2003 Africa Cup of Nations qualifier, where Morocco won 1-0.
Morocco had not lost in their last four matches, while Sierra Leone had a poor recent form with only one win in their last seven games.
Post-Match Reflections: Morocco's national team is preparing for the Africa Cup of Nations, with their next matches on January 17 and 21 against Tanzania and DR Congo respectively.
Sierra Leone failed to qualify for the Africa Cup of Nations and are focusing on World Cup qualifying matches starting in June 2024.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played behind closed doors and not broadcast, but updates were provided by VAVEL.
Key players like Hakim Ziyech and Saiss were not in the starting lineup due to discomfort.
Others: The match was Morocco's only warm-up game before the Africa Cup of Nations due to the cancellation of their game against Gambia.
